docs.snippet: The Latest on the publication by a coalition of media outlets of an investigation into offshore financial dealings by the rich and famous (all times local):
docs.lead_paragraph: The Latest on the publication by a coalition of media outlets of an investigation into offshore financial dealings by the rich and famous (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: Panama Law Firm Helped Company Tied to Mugabe
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Panama Law Firm Helped Company Tied to Mugabe

docs.snippet: More than 800 wealthy Australians are under investigation by the Australian Taxation Office for possible tax evasion linked to their alleged dealings with a Panamanian law firm, the tax agency said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 800 wealthy Australians are under investigation by the Australian Taxation Office for possible tax evasion linked to their alleged dealings with a Panamanian law firm, the tax agency said on Monday.

headline.main: 800 Australians Investigated After Offshore Accounts Leak
headline.print_headline: 800 Australians Investigated After Offshore Accounts Leak

docs.snippet: Governments across the world began investigating possible financial wrongdoing by the rich and powerful on Monday after a leak of four decades of documents from a Panamanian law firm that specialised in setting up offshore companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Governments across the world began investigating possible financial wrongdoing by the rich and powerful on Monday after a leak of four decades of documents from a Panamanian law firm that specialised in setting up offshore companies.

docs.snippet: The head of a Panama-based law firm at the center of a massive leak of offshore financial data on Sunday denied any wrongdoing, and said his firm has fallen victim to "an international campaign against privacy".
docs.lead_paragraph: The head of a Panama-based law firm at the center of a massive leak of offshore financial data on Sunday denied any wrongdoing, and said his firm has fallen victim to "an international campaign against privacy".

headline.main: Panama Lawyer at Center of Data Leak Denounces Attack on Privacy
headline.print_headline: Panama Lawyer at Center of Data Leak Denounces Attack on Privacy

docs.snippet: Years of safety lapses as well as petty annoyances reveal how a grand vision of American liberalism has collided with reality.
docs.lead_paragraph: Years of safety lapses as well as petty annoyances reveal how a grand vision of American liberalism has collided with reality.
docs.abstract: Subway system serving Washington, DC, faces deteriorating infrastructure and cash deficits as it hits 40th year in operation; city's transit authority has announced that nation's second-busiest transit system could face $100 million budget deficit in coming year, and that whole lines may be shut down for months for critical repairs to aging system.

headline.main: Washington Metro, 40 and Creaking, Stares at a Midlife Crisis
headline.print_headline: Capital’s Metro, Creaking at 40, Is Staring Down a Midlife Crisis

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and NICHOLAS FANDOS

docs.snippet: News media outlets said the documents revealed the accounts of 140 politicians, including figures with close ties to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
docs.lead_paragraph: News media outlets said the documents revealed the accounts of 140 politicians, including figures with close ties to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
docs.abstract: Group of investigative journalism organizations release articles based on what are being described as 11.5 million leaked legal documents from Panama law firm providing details on how 140 of world's most affluent individuals set up offshore bank accounts; documents identify wide range of politicians and public officials, including 12 current and former world leaders and some individuals with ties to Pres Vladimir V Putin of Russia.

headline.main: Panama Law Firm’s Leaked Files Detail Offshore Accounts Tied to World Leaders

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and STEVEN LEE MYERS

docs.snippet: There could be important consequences if such emissions are falling more than a decade earlier than expected, but finding the answer is difficult.
docs.lead_paragraph: There could be important consequences if such emissions are falling more than a decade earlier than expected, but finding the answer is difficult.
docs.abstract: Memo from China; some researchers perusing recent energy data think carbon dioxide emissions in China have peaked and are dropping, more than decade earlier than forecast; decline could have important consequences for efforts to limit global warming, but it is difficult to determine if data is accurate.

headline.main: China’s Carbon Emissions May Have Peaked, but It’s Hazy
headline.print_headline: Carbon Emissions May Have Peaked, but Data Is Hazy

docs.snippet: The mayor of Philadelphia thinks a tax will go down easier when it’s about raising money for something, not just about making people drink less soda.
docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor of Philadelphia thinks a tax will go down easier when it’s about raising money for something, not just about making people drink less soda.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; proposals to tax sugar-sweetened drinks have been unsuccessful in New York State and San Francisco, but Philadelphia Mayor Jim Kenney is presenting tax as windfall of cash for city projects; says 3-cents-an-ounce soda tax could not only boost public health but could bring city more than $400 million in extra revenue over five years.

headline.main: Making a Soda Tax More Politically Palatable
headline.print_headline: Pointing to Cash, Not Health, to Make a Soda Tax Palatable

docs.snippet: Australian author, journalist and speech writer for the center-left Labor Party Bob Ellis died at his Sydney home of liver cancer on Sunday, his son said. He was 73 years old.
docs.lead_paragraph: Australian author, journalist and speech writer for the center-left Labor Party Bob Ellis died at his Sydney home of liver cancer on Sunday, his son said. He was 73 years old.

headline.main: Australian Writer Bob Ellis Dies in Sydney of Cancer Aged 73
headline.print_headline: Australian Writer Bob Ellis Dies in Sydney of Cancer Aged 73

docs.snippet: Samsung Bioepis Co Ltd, which aims to become a force in the fledgling biosimilar drugs industry, has filed a lawsuit against the originator of the world's best-selling drug, to stop it blocking the launch of its own version.
docs.lead_paragraph: Samsung Bioepis Co Ltd, which aims to become a force in the fledgling biosimilar drugs industry, has filed a lawsuit against the originator of the world's best-selling drug, to stop it blocking the launch of its own version.

headline.main: Samsung Brings in the Lawyers for Biosimilars Push
headline.print_headline: Samsung Brings in the Lawyers for Biosimilars Push
